<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Captivator Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3358) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 120</row>

**Archetype** [Captivator](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=125)

**Prerequisites**
Charisma 14; Trained in [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) or Trained in [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6)

</column>

---

Your ability to captivate others borders on the preternatural. You are seldom at a loss in social situations, and you can create minor [enchantments](/Traits.aspx?ID=61) or [illusions](/Traits.aspx?ID=92). Choose Deception or Diplomacy. You become trained in that skill, or become an expert if you were already trained.

 Choose two cantrips from the [occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) list; each cantrip must be from either the enchantment or illusion school. You gain access to the Cast a Spell activity and can cast these spells as occult innate spells. You're trained in occult spell attack rolls and spell DCs. If you have a hand free, you can usually replace material components with somatic components, so you don't need to use a spell [component pouch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=33). Your key spellcasting ability for these spells is Charisma.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the captivator archetype.

<title level="2">Captivator Dedication leads to...</title>
[Basic Captivator Spellcasting](/Feats.aspx?ID=3359), [Effortless Captivation](/Feats.aspx?ID=3365), [Heightened Captivation](/Feats.aspx?ID=3362), [Look Again](/Feats.aspx?ID=3367), [Reactive Charm](/Feats.aspx?ID=3364)
